programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: Benson is assigned a 24/7 security detail when William Lewis (Pablo Schreiber) escapes from prison and starts killing again; Benson must decide how much she is willing to sacrifice to save a child's life.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Sgt. Olivia Benson is investigated by Internal Affairs after William Lewis' death; as pressure mounts, Olivia has to choose between her convictions and her badge.

programme.desc: Benson and Murphy question a television producer when he is accused of molesting his daughter; Benson strives to discover the truth as accusations fly in the media.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan investigate when pulverized human remains are found in a garbage bag; Angela's father (Billy F. Gibbons) seeks revenge on Hodgins.

programme.desc: An openly gay Navy lieutenant set to receive the Medal of Honor is murdered; Palmer gets ready for fatherhood.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When an explosion rocks a summit on global terror, the team suspects Gibbs' archenemy is responsible; Gibbs tries to help Fornell after his wife's murder.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A murder victim turns out to have been living under an alias created for one of Gibbs' undercover cases from 20 years ago.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the world of black market art when evidence in a murder case reveals that a rare painting has been swapped for a fake.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a dead thief is found in a Marine's home, the NCIS team finds the calling card of a terror group the Department of Defense had been tracking.

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a Navy ensign from the Office of Naval Intelligence is murdered, Special Agent Ned Dorneget (Matt Jones) from NCIS cyber operations helps investigate; Jake and Gibbs' friendship is revealed.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A case escalates into a global initiative when it's discovered that an international terrorist group that recruits children has been buying bombs off the black market.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: After a deadly bombing overseas, the team pursues a global terrorist group -- and suffers an emotional loss.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs fights for his life on a Navy hospital ship, while DiNozzo and Joanna go to Shanghai to take down the Calling.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When Gibbs asks the team to help DEA Agent Luis Mitchell with a case, DiNozzo makes a discovery about Gibbs' connection to the agent; Gibbs debuts a new look.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Hours after calling Gibbs about a possible case, a Marine is found dead in Quantico; McGee and Bishop pose as a married couple.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Vance returns to field duty -- with Gibbs as his partner -- when a murder investigation has a connection to a former NCIS agent incarcerated for stealing evidence.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: When Myles' sister's law firm is suspected of being dirty, Jack and Sue go undercover as lawyer and assistant to find out how deep the corruption goes.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: When Sue's snitch Howie witnesses a murder, Sue and Jack go undercover to investigate a possible mob connection. But Bobby and Myles feel they've got the tougher assignment: babysitting Howie.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: When Sue and the team discover a cache of illegal VISAs, they track the makers to the 'black market' - only to make a disturbing discovery as to what's really for sale.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike can't wait to hit the open road and go bass fishing with Skip. The first stop on their trip is Lou's bar. A pleasant morning turns into a dangerous afternoon when Hammer realizes that a team of violent bank robbers is sitting at the next table. The situation spirals and after a shoot out that leaves Grady wounded, the volatile men and their lingerie-clad femme fatale hold everyone in the bar hostage. Now, Hammer must keep everyone safe and stop the criminals, all without his gun.

programme.desc: Bull and the team travel to Miami with J.P. Nunnelly to work on a controversial drug trafficking case in which both the clients' and the jurors' lives are in danger.

programme.desc: The team must find the person responsible for a sarin gas attack on a Los Angeles bus before a larger incident occurs.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: With digital forensics, authorities are able to debunk the alibi of one of the last people to see a 24-year-old missing jogger in rural Arkansas, making him the primary suspect in her murder; first-time interviews with the victim's family.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: The family of a missing Texas mother becomes concerned when they start receiving suspicious text messages from her phone; unsolved for years, a trail of digital clues ultimately helps investigators build a compelling case against her murderer.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: A love triangle at the University of Florida results in the murder of a popular student; an undeniable digital trail leads straight to his murderer and helps authorities piece together the details of the crime and secure a conviction.

programme.title: Witness to Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: After the gruesome murder of an aspiring actor in Georgia, police quickly run out of leads; a new digital forensic tool breathes life into the investigation, allowing authorities to identify the killer with pinpoint precision.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The native Hawaiians trace their ancestry to beings from the Pleiades star system called the Akua; a look at these islands and if they once had been inhabited by extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at if ancient aliens could have shaped human evolution by introducing viral epidemics on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: According to some Ancient Astronaut theorists, entities that have been described as ghosts, angels and extraterrestrials are actually visitors from unseen realms and they walk on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the ancient world, structures were built to mirror the constellations in the night sky and this is only apparent when they are viewed from high above; a look at the possibility that these structures were designed as messages.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether surviving freezing temperatures, diving unfathomable depths in one breath, or lifting weighty objects, superhuman feats never cease to amaze; pulling them off could be a matter of training, willpower, genetics, or something more mysterious.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is: what happens to us after we die? Perhaps clues to the answer lie in unusual cases of near-death experience.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Some archeological finds are so baffling, they challenge what is known about the past; learning the truth about these mysterious ruins and answering the questions they continue to present.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: From the ancient Babylonians to modern-day urban explorers, mankind has always been fascinated by abandoned places; discovering the allure that draws people to post-apocalyptic landscapes.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: All over the world are forbidden "triangles" that are mysterious regions where ships, planes and people enter and then just disappear; they are found in Bermuda, Alaska, Japan and elsewhere.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: More than 80% of the Earth's oceans remain unexplored, and in many ways, the underwater world is the final frontier; as new technology allows people to explore oceans and deep lakes more than ever before, nobody knows what they will find.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: King Arthur, England's first pop culture superhero; his exploits inspired blockbuster movies and television series like "Middle Earth", "Harry Potter", "Game of Thrones" and "Star Wars"; the significant impact of Arthurian legend on Western culture.

programme.desc: For many, UFO experiences and extraterrestrial encounters have been happening for decades, but not all accounts are made public; there are those who believe that a secret entity has been covering up these stories and suppressing the witnesses.

programme.desc: Host Zach Quinto sets out to discover whether Aliens exist and what evidence we have to prove it. He meets with several people who say they have encountered extra-terrestrial life.

programme.title: UFO Cover Ups: Secrets Revealed Special Edition
programme.desc: For many, UFO experiences and extraterrestrial encounters have been happening for decades, but not all accounts are made public; there are those who believe that a secret entity has been covering up these stories and suppressing the witnesses.

programme.title: Killer Kids
programme.desc: A teenager is coerced into a criminal plan by a vindictive mother and forced to choose between the love of his girlfriend, the secret she carries, or murder.

programme.title: Killer Kids

programme.title: Killer Kids
programme.desc: Two teenage boys become obsessed with the Scream film franchise, and plan a copycat murder spree where no one is safe.

programme.title: Crime 360

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Prairie dogs have their own language and one of the most complex communications in the animal kingdom. Plus an owls hearing can pick up a heartbeat over 100 feet away. And leaf cutter ants slice through foliage with jaws that vibrate 1000 times/second!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siamang is no ordinary ape, its arms are longer than its legs and can swing 30 feet in a single bound! And the male wood duck is one of the most colorful creatures on Earth. Wonder why? The Tamandua uses a secret weapon to slurp up 10000 insects/day!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Imagine a World where all our energy needs are met without polluting our atmosphere. Science and technology are inching closer to making this a possibility. Join Philippe Cousteau to see what's being done to ensure a safe and healthy future!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: A careless accident that may take mere moments can cause environmental damage that lasts decades, even longer. So what can we do to limit the long term ramifications?

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: An animal series with a uniquely scientific approach shows how and why creatures are able to excel.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Did you know a beavers teeth never stop growing and that it can use them to build dams big enough to see from outer space? A flock of Canada geese can migrate 1500 miles in a single day. Plus, the Bison can move 40 mph!

programme.title: It Takes a Killer

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: The random murder of a woman in Central Montana sends law enforcement on the hunt for a killer; using a network of informants and good old fashioned methods the authorities track down the mentally unstable man behind the motiveless crime.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When a Southern California high school teacher suddenly dies, it appears his death was due to natural causes, but once law enforcement starts looking into his widow, they uncover her treacherous past and her preference for using poison to kill.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer

programme.title: It Takes a Killer

programme.title: It Takes a Killer

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Todd Helton hits three homers in a game for the second time, leading the Rockies to a 12-5 win over the Dodgers.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Bryce Harper found himself as the hometown favorite when it came to the 2018 Home Run Derby at Nationals Park in D.C. The former MVP put on a show for the fans, taking down Freddie Freeman, Max Muncy and Kyle Schwarber on his way to an exciting victory.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Jim Leyritz hits an iconic 3-run HR in the 8th that allowed the Yankees to win in the 10th inning

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Paul Blair hits a walk-off single to give the Yankees a Game 1 win in the 1977 World Series

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The National League battles back twice late in a thrilling victory, highlighted by clutch hits from Fred McGriff and Moises Alou. The 1994 MLB All-Star Game was the first NL win since 1987.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: "The Mets' Amazin' rally vs. the Red Sox, Kirk Gibson's 'impossible' homer and more.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Scott Rolen hit a two-run homer off Randy Johnson in Game 1 of the 2002 NLDS, his first postseason HR.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/11/03: Tempers were rising between the Red Sox and Yankees in the 2003 ALCS. After plenty of jawing from both teams, the benches eventually cleared which led to Pedro Martinez tossing 72-year-old Don Zimmer to the ground during the scuffle.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Yankees hit three homers, highlighted by Judge's first postseason jack, to advance to the ALDS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 8/12/18 - David Bote lifts a pinch-hit walk-off grand slam to erase a three-run deficit with two outs in the bottom of the 9th inning against the Nationals.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Down three runs with two outs in the ninth, the Red Sox fought back against the Yankees.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Brandon Woodruff homers and earns the win to lead the Brewers to a win in Game 1 of the 2018 NLCS.

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network Presents: Birds of a Different Game - The Story of the 1980's St. Louis Cardinals

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network Presents a look back at the emotional first sporting event in New York following September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: Baseball returns after a strike-shortened 1981 season and sees the St. Louis Cardinals emerge as World Series champions for the ninth time.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Sean Burroughs hits a walk-off in the 10th to give the Padres a 4-3 win at Petco Park's opener

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The National League battles back twice late in a thrilling victory, highlighted by clutch hits from Fred McGriff and Moises Alou. The 1994 MLB All-Star Game was the first NL win since 1987.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cristy talks Rachel and Bogi into helping her restore and flip a Yamaha R6.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew takes drastic measures to seal all of a '69 Cougar's leaks.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew checks off items from a wish list for a military mom's Mustang.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew finds some parts to give a '78 Mustang some new life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi finds a BMW M3 she wants for herself, but it needs a lot of work.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team beefs up a Scat Pack Challenger with twin turbos and new axles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Cutlass needs a new top, plus a lot of work on the interior.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '33 Ford Roadster with a dead cylinder is getting a new 355 crate engine.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '53 F-100 on a '99 Lightning chassis has been in project mode for years.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A rare '89 Turbo Trans Am gets items knocked off the owner's wish list.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '75 El Camino swaps its bench seat for bucket seats and a center console.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2011 Jeep Wrangler is a reliable and fun vehicle to drive off to college.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team builds two Indian Scout Bobbers, each with a distinct personality.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The forgotten Mustang is back to have its leaky 302 engine replaced.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A special guest helps build a new Ford F-150 that will be sold for charity.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Polaris Slingshot and a Vanderhall are in the shop for some upgrades.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '65 C10 lowrider gets a new all-electronic 4L60E transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An autocross Malibu wagon needs work some on the steering before race day.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team retrofits a Jeepster Commando with a custom power-steering setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Lincoln gets a boost in power and fuel economy by adding EFI.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring back a vintage Jeepster Commando and convert its vintage brakes from drum to disc.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Addressing what type of maintenance is needed on a company's work truck; the girls demonstrate general maintenance, fix some broken items and give it an upgrade or two.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls tackle an incomplete, but drivable Pontiac GTO convertible by replacing the mechanics in the convertible top and putting on new exterior pieces.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2005 Jeep TJ Wrangler Rubicon is in the All Girls Garage because its owner wants to be able to use it off-road; it will need a new long arm suspension kit, new roll cage and new tires.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1966 Ford Mustang Coupe had an extensive renovation in 2009, but there are a few items that still need to be finished; the girls will address a couple of interior and exterior items to take this restoration project to the finish line.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1989 Toyota Supra has twin turbos and a potent straight 6 engine; the girls will switch out the twin turbos for a single and get more power out of the 1JZ motor; Faye's windshield gets rescued from a rock chip that could be disastrous.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1971 Pontiac LeMans is brought into the shop with an overheating issue; the crew will upgrade the car's radiator and add electric fans, then go to work replacing some worn interior parts as well.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: One of the lifters in a 1971 Chevy Camaro has stopped working; the team will have to remove the engine in order to upgrade the camshaft, lifters, bearings, and timing chain before putting it all back together.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew gets one of the first Honda Civic Type R's into the shop; the car is already a powerhouse, but it's not good enough for the track, so they will give it some modifications and upgrades to make it race-worthy.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team performs some minor repairs and adjustments to a 1966 Nova Super Sport so the owner can quickly flip it.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang brings a 1976 J10 into the garage for comparison as they personalize a 2020 Jeep Gladiator for a customer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang installs upgrades to a 2017 Ford Mustang GT they find for an empty-nester mom who is looking for some excitement in her life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Corvette gets a top-end rebuild and a factory exhaust reinstall.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2018 Kia stinger GT goes from beast to monster with aftermarket goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Oldsmobile Cutlass goes from an automatic transmission to a manual.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An '03 BMW 325i needs a timing chain and has a parasitic electrical draw.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Mustang with a supercharged engine needs more throttle response.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls find a stock Mercedes-AMG E 55 and do some European hot rodding.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An MGB with a Ford Ranger engine isn't running the correct fuel setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Camaro swaps out its 305 small block for a 383 that will make 450hp.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew diagnoses and fixes some problems on a Dodge Avenger; they demonstrate how to know when motor mounts are bad, and how to easily fix a cracked bumper.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in a stock supercharged CTS-V and converts it to twin turbos; they put an intake manifold where the supercharger was, and then put in a new exhaust that includes turbos.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: This mid-engine classic needs to get back on the road; the crew goes through the engine to see if it needs a rebuild, then overhauls the fuel delivery system to get this build over some major hurdles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine and finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The new-generation, mid-engine Corvette is here, and the girls take one for a test drive; the C8 is already cool, but they make it better with aftermarket exhaust and some other goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in Faye's 1980 VW Rabbit for some fabrication.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls have to figure out why an '87 C10 isn't running anymore; they know it's a fuel problem that happened after an EFI setup was installed; they finish up with a new disc-brake kit; Bogi takes a field trip to show how custom fuel lines are made.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how to rebuild and upgrade an R154 manual transmission so it will last as long as the Toyota engine; they also drop a valve body on an automatic transmission, drilling it out and adding stronger sleeves to keep it lasting longer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls take an old AMC Spirit drag car and get it ready for the street by changing out the oversized carb. They bring in a special guest to help them pick out the right carb and tune it on the car.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in a rare Caprice cop car to bolt on a supercharger from a second-generation CTS-V; they'll make brackets for the intercooler, bolt on the supercharger and give the rare cop car some extra power.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cars die of boredom, so it wasn't great for a Plymouth Prowler to sit in a museum for 15 years; the girls show what areas to fix before the car gets back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how a worn-out Toyota's steering rack and pinion works, where they fail, and how to rebuild it with a simple rebuild kit.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A GTO that has spent a lot of its life in shops with mechanics who had no intention of finishing it, is brought in by its owner for some final touches, including checking gauges, air conditioning and the steering column.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye find a 1972 Challenger at a customer's house, and when they learned how it was a triple black, they discuss restoring it to original; the work starts with rebuilding the numbers-matching 340.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou work on their first Dodge Viper with a bolt-on supercharger.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou use titanium to build a custom exhaust for a Toyota Supra.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou repair the convertible top on a 1964 Lincoln Continental.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou work on a pair of Grand Nationals from the 1980s.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Lou works on a vintage Mercedes 300D while Jared upgrades a BMW 335D.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys show off 50 years of Camaro, from prototype No. 1 to COPO Camaro.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou dial up a Ferrari F430, giving it a whole new look and sound.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou work on a Camaro IROC-Z with an original 305 engine.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou add an upgraded turbo kit to a Ford Mustang EcoBoost.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou show how to put 5-lug disc brakes on a Fox-body Mustang.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou add 120 horsepower to a Camaro Z28 with a supercharger kit.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou do some custom fabrication on Rickey Gadson's motorcycle.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou turn a Mercedes-Benz E550 into a Black Series E-Class AMG.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou do a Hemi swap on a Dodge to take a 5.7L engine to a 6.4L.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys finish the Hemi install and upgrade the brakes on a 1964 Ford.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou work on a Volkswagen GTI with a burnt clutch.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou show how C10 truck parts cross over to a 1989 Chevy G10 van.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Bryan Fuller's work over ten years on a '33 hot rod is about to pay off.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Bryan and Jeremy tear the original drum brakes off a Land Cruiser FJ40.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Bryan and Jeremy bring in a '69 Continental and slam it to the ground.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: An LS3-powered C10 stepside is in to fit its headers to the stock exhaust.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Bryan and Jeremy take an F-100 restoration that was supposed to be all original and switch gears; starting with a new Coyote engine and a supercharger under the hood, this project is destined for more custom touches.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys adapt a supercharger to look period correct under the hood of a Studebaker with a rare and unusual 302 engine; they create custom accessory mounts for the supercharger, and finish it all up with a hidden EFI setup.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys find out the hard way what happens when they put a 6.2 liter supercharged Hellcrate engine in a '73 Challenger; when the factory rear end blows up, they swap it out for an upgrade with the right gear setup.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller brings in a twin-turbo, thousand-horsepower Cutlass to do some custom fabrication and build an all-new interior.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Jeremy take a first-generation Scout apart and put an all-new chassis, drive train and 4-link suspension underneath.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a very clean '69 fastback Mustang; the owner has added extra power under the hood, Bryan and Jeremy need to upgrade the rear end with a Posi unit; they also upgrade the transmission to give the owner a few extra gears.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys build a spare tire carrier for the massive MegaRexx MegaRaptor.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: A Buick Roadmaster woodie wagon is getting a complete restoration, and the guys will show when a body panel is worth saving and when it needs to be scrapped; they also bring some of the old wood back to life.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jeremy brings in his mom's 1965 Mustang for a V-8 swap; they'll take out the factory motor and put in a 302, then install a complete front end in it with coil-overs to give it a much smoother ride than the factory suspension.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus bring in a rare '50s mail truck and completely rebuild the front end out of metal; they also take a trip to a nearby car museum to see one of the first all-electric mail trucks ever, which was built in the '70s.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus demonstrate how to take modern design techniques like flush-mounted glass and custom drip rails and convert those elements onto a 1986 Monte Carlo.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Some project cars need every body panel replaced, so Fuller and Bumpus show how to work with new sheet metal panels on a 1963 Impala; they also find a running Road Runner to have some fun with.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a vintage 1979 Jeep that is being sent to auction to give it a finished interior with carpet and panels; Jeremy uses a sewing machine to bind the carpet edges.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus bring in a 1981 DMC-12, and with the help of some DeLorean experts, they get the famous movie car running again.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus bring in a 1959 Ford Edsel and take out the stock transmission to put in an automatic overdrive and give the classic car extra shifting power.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys pull apart a transmission to show the wear items, and install a performance clutch on a modified Chevy.

programme.desc: Dave and Fred buy some VW project cars they can turn into Baja Bugs.

programme.desc: The M715 is in the shop to make it drivable, then it's off to the trail.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day

programme.title: Dirt Every Day

programme.desc: The guys take last season's dirty-green 4Runner snow-bashing in Oregon.

They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

programme.desc: Nathan and Naomi are at odds about the direction of their marriage, and reluctance to get in the Christmas Spirit is shown by Nathan. As an ultimatum, it is insisted by Naomi that the holidays are spent by Nathan with her and her family, but it is Christmas Eve. The help of Nathan's cousin Keith is enlisted, and a road trip is embarked upon by the two as they race against time. An attempt is made to get home for the holidays and save the marriage.

programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.desc: At Fort Bridger in the Wyoming Territory, frontiersman and scout Kit Carson (Jon Hall) receives a request to guide a wagon train over the Oregon Trail to California. Concerned by the dangers of Indian attacks, Carson hesitates, but then agrees despite the wagon train having already arranged for protection from a cavalry unit led by Capt. John Fremont (Dana Andrews). On the journey, Caron and Fremont clash several times over leadership -- and the attentions of Dolores Murphy (Lynn Bari).

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Sheriff Gene is up against a newspaperman who prints headlines reporting crimes before they are committed.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene helps a lady regain her prodigal son who has been implicated in some criminal activities.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A crusading newspaperwoman tries to clean up a lawless community single-handedly.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene and Pat help a courageous old lady defend a ranch after the owner is murdered.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Cavalry officer Gene Autry helps prove the innocence of an Indian tribe.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene must apprehend a group of outlaws harassing Pat as he tries to operate a dry-goods store.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene and Pat help a reformed outlaw and his daughter when a rich and unscrupulous man tries to blackmail them.

programme.title: Stampede
programme.desc: As a dispute erupts over water access, a rancher falls for a charming settler while crooked businessmen try to play both sides of the conflict.

programme.title: El Condor
programme.desc: After escaping from a chain gang, Luke (Jim Brown) partners with tough prospector Jaroo (Lee Van Cleef) to search for gold in a Mexican fort. The enterprising duo manage to convince Apache chief Santana (Iron Eyes Cody) and his tribe to help them infiltrate the fort, which is defended by Mexican military officer Chavez (Patrick O'Neal) and his men. While things don't go according to plan, Chavez's lover, Claudine (Mariana Hill), falls for Luke, which proves helpful to the scrappy bandits.

programme.title: The Five Man Army
programme.desc: A bandit (Peter Graves) and his gang target a Mexican general's trainload of gold for the revolution in 1914.

programme.title: Last Stand at Saber River
programme.desc: From an Elmore Leonard book.

programme.title: Rio Bravo
programme.desc: When gunslinger Joe Burdette (Claude Akins) kills a man in a saloon, Sheriff John T. Chance (John Wayne) arrests him with the aid of the town drunk, Dude (Dean Martin). Before long, Burdette's brother, Nathan (John Russell), comes around, indicating that he's prepared to bust his brother out of jail if necessary. Chance decides to make a stand until reinforcements arrive, enlisting Dude, an old cripple named Stumpy (Walter Brennan) and baby-faced cowboy Colorado Ryan (Ricky Nelson) to help.

programme.title: The Train Robbers
programme.desc: After the death of her husband, Mrs. Lowe (Ann-Margret) posts a $50,000 reward in return for help recovering her train-robber beau's hidden fortune, under the pretense of returning it. Lane (John Wayne) assembles a group of cowboys to head to Mexico with Mrs. Lowe, enticed by the reward money. As they cross into Mexico, however, they realize they're being followed, by both a posse of bandits and a single mysterious rider (Ricardo Montalban) with his own agenda.

programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: A Mexican-American War veteran, Jeremiah Johnson (Robert Redford), heads to the mountains to live in isolation. Woefully unequipped for the task at hand, Johnson is fortunate to come across a seasoned mountain man (Will Geer) willing to teach him the necessary survival tactics. As life continues in the mountains, Johnson finds himself a native bride (Delle Bolton) and an adopted son (Josh Albee). However, their peaceful existence is threatened when Johnson incurs the ire of the Crow Indians.

programme.title: Sergeant Rutledge
programme.desc: At a U.S. Army fort in the Arizona Territory in 1881, an officer is murdered and his beautiful young daughter is beaten, raped and strangled. Army lawyer Tom Cantrell (Jeffrey Hunter) defends the accused, African-American sergeant Braxton Rutledge (Woody Strode), a soldier who had once been under his command. Under questioning by Cantrell and the prosecutor (Carleton Young), multiple witnesses piece together the truth of what happened at the fort that day.

programme.title: Wagons West
programme.desc: A wagonmaster (Rod Cameron) bound for California has gunrunners and Indians to worry about.

programme.title: The Over-the-Hill Gang
programme.desc: A retired Texas Ranger and his three aging pals set out to clean up a lawless town and remove its evil, corrupt mayor from office.

programme.title: The Legend of Butch & Sundance
programme.desc: The young outlaws (David Clayton Rogers, Ryan Browning) and their Hole-in-the-Wall Gang rob greedy land barons and become folk heroes.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: After answering Chief Flying Cloud's smoke signal for help in preventing an Indian war, Cisco and Pancho go undercover as Professor Lorenzo Lombardi and Chief Waho's Cure-All Medicine Show.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A pair of silver smugglers murder their partner, a local rancher, when he tries to back out of the operation. Cisco and Pancho set out to get them.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid and his English-mangling sidekick Pancho travel the old west in the grand tradition of the Lone Ranger, righting wrongs and fighting injustice wherever they find it.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho get mixed up with a sharpshooting lady gambler and a gang of counterfeiters.

programme.desc: While arresting two gunmen at the saloon, Jake Hoyt saves Hollister from being shot in the back by a third gunman; Hoyt has an ulterior motive for saving Hollister's life.

programme.desc: Crooks target old prospector Cactus Charlie after he discovers their hidden stash of stolen gold.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to Cledan Valley in Mid Wales, where husband and wife duo Russ and Karen Colman hope their glamping site will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Springfield House in Instow, Devon, where Lucinda Renshaw, who is joined in the competition by friend Diane Passmore, transformed this home in to a B&B eight years ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Huddersfield, where John Whitworth hopes the unique style of The Edge Accommodation has enough personality to win over his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Darwin Lake Holiday Village in Matlock, managed by best friends Sally McAnulty and Teresa Shirley, who take pride in their exclusive village feel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group head to Sands Resort Hotel and Spa in Newquay, where father-and-son team Nicholas and Tom Malcolm pride themselves on the vast facilities they have on offer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Oak Tree Lane Yurt Site in Bratton Clovelly, Devon, where owner Phil Gilbert is taking things back to basics. On arrival, the guests are wowed by the Mongolian yurts.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Church Street Cobbles in Macclesfield, where foodie Debbie Quinn and housekeeper, cook and cleaner Isobel Reisen recently opened a B&B above a barber shop.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to rock and roll venue The Vic Bikers pub in Leicestershire where siblings John and Joy take a more laid back approach to running the business.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On day three, Steve and Verity hope the luxury touches will win over their guests at The Cranberries Hideaway in Devon.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Mehfil Hotel in Southall, London, where spiritual host Arun and his sister Rashmi hope to bring some Indian hospitality to the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Helmsley North Yorkshire at Laskill Country House, where straight-talking farmer's daughter Mandy Sowray and friend Anny Harrison run a tight ship.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Swan Hotel in Telford owned by Chris Witton and his spiritual friend Rammy. They are hoping straightforward value for money will win them the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers head to Scalford Hall Hotel in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire where Colin Warburg, along with student son Ben, hope their 81 room country pile will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the competition this week is to The Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by confident young colleagues Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Oaklea Barns Guest House in Merseyside, where Mandi Magee and partner Paul Green think their impeccable standards will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire, where partners Dave and Sanchia aim to win over their guests with their 300-year-old cottage turned guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, where Ian Nicholls hopes they'll leave their designer gear at the door and bunk up in his cheap and cheerful dorms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Parsonage Hotel and Spa in York, where Mark Toole and Natalie Allcock look to wow their guests with their country manor, complete with pub, spa and restaurant.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Truro, Cornwall, at Causilgey Manor, where former art dealers Robin and Brenda Spence want to treat their guests to a stay in the Cornish countryside.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Elmfield B&B in Devon, where retired politician Martin Perry and housekeeper Tracey Barrett pride themselves on keeping things traditional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Chocolate Box in Bournemouth, where hosts Leoni Wilton and Tish Broughton want to swathe their guests in the sweet stuff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to The Buckle Seaford, in East Sussex, where B&B newbies Julie and Jason Martin have set sail for seaside luxe. Can they chart a course for victory?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Ayr, Scotland, at Blackburn Villa where Karen runs a home from home B&B helped by daughter Jade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gretna Green, Scotland, where Kieran and fianc√©e Paula of The Hazeldene are proud of the marital importance of their hotel, but suspect game playing by their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&B'ers head to Pembrokeshire, Wales, and 32 Townhouse, where Dominic Swingler and his mum Eileen hope their style and d√©cor wows their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Greylands Guest House, in Powys Wales, where Lynda Fry and Larnie Carter have set high standards for themselves.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Norfolk at The Old Ram Coaching Inn, five-star trained Victoria MacDonald welcomes the guests. But there's a dusty towel rail and suspicious brown smudge in the toilet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Ye Old Crown in Edenbridge, where chef and owner Aaron Webster aims to deliver a three star service for a two star price, but Victoria is looking for payback.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Beach Lodge Hotel in Mablethorpe, hosts Michele and Cheryl aim to offer the perfect beachside break. The rooms seem to hit the spot at first, but then there's a hair-raising incident.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Farmer's Arms, Taunton, where Alan and Alison hope their palatial rooms will win them the competition, but Michele and Cheryl are unimpressed by the cleanliness.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to The Waverley Hotel in Callander, Scotland, owned by husband and wife Gordon and Jan Halladay, who are are shocked and surprised at some of the scores.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Greenview Guesthouse in Cumbria, owned by Tanya Briggs, with help from best friend Vicky Hope. There's some fishy business and one guest goes green at the gills.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the lavish Hotel Sheraton in Blackpool, run by mum and son Liz and Ollie Brown, and where Rory discovers his own personal illuminations in the bathroom.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Chapter Two Accommodation in Malton, where Katharine and Rory offer proper Yorkshire hospitality and a belly busting offering at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in north Norfolk at The Hero, run by best mates Harry and Rowan, who both quit university to follow their dream of becoming hospitality entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cleasewood Guest House in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, a labour of love for rookie B&B owners Debbie and Arthur Callaghan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the B&Bers head to Peel Hey on the Wirral, where boss Helen Holmes and assistant Suzanne hope their seven decades of experience will give them the edge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Four Saints Brig Y Don in Llandudno, where Egyptian-born owner Shoukry, with best friend Waguih, believes his `international standard' hotel will scoop him the prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off in Lynton, Devon at The Seawood Hotel, managed by couple Martin and Kyle Fletcher, who hope to win over their guests with their high standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gooseford Farm B&B in Dartmoor, Devon, managed by Mary Courtier and husband Julian. The farmhouse impresses but Jean and Dec are left counting the cost.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to Trevarrian Lodge in Newquay Cornwall, where Jean and her pro-chef husband, Dec Hegarty are hoping the food will win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Rivendell Outdoor Club, a clothing-optional resort in Wimborne, Dorset, managed by Kerry Murphy and Andy Gautry. However, not everyone is keen to let it all hang out.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition starts in Barmouth, north Wales, at the Bae Abermaw Hotel, run by newly engaged couple Rosie Lewis and Dexter Green. On arrival, guest Tracy finds herself in a hairy situation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Rigsby's Guest House in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, run by Tracy Ward. The lack of en-suite bathrooms causes a stink, and some guests cannot figure out the pricing.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Somerset Arms in Semington, Wiltshire, where John Adams is joined by friend Dennis Gowie. But cleanliness issues and thin walls gave cause for concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Cross Keys Hotel, Saffron Walden, Essex run by former flight attendant Nici Van Valen. The guests love the luxury but a mark on Tracy's towel leaves a stain on her stay and tensions are at boiling point.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: First up, Jon and Lisa welcome their rivals to the Swan Motel in Norfolk, but some of their guests find a surprise in their drawers. Later, Jon shows off his magical hosting skills on a boat tour.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michael and Scott welcome their rivals to the Hare and Hounds in Essex. They take their guests clay pigeon shooting, but Jon and Lisa find it hard to forget the feedback that their hosts gave them the day before.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sir Ben Slade welcomes his rivals to the 13th-century Maunsel House in Somerset, but the extra charge for a hot breakfast leaves some guests with a bad taste in their mouths. Meanwhile, Jon and Lisa turn detective to uncover Ben's past.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gary and Linda Kellaway welcome their rivals to Lower Keats Glamping in Devon. At dinner, Jon turns joker, but Michael and Scott have a big revelation, which is no laughing matter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four more sets of bed and breakfast owners compete, kicking off in Tyne and Wear at Tynemouth 61, owned by hospitality veteran Stephen Minns, who grew up believing he was born with blue blood.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Black Horse Inn in North Yorkshire, where unlikely double act manager Steve Barker and side-kick and bar manager Callum Dixon believe they can win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to The Shores Hotel in Blackpool, where bed and breakfast beginner Enid Hall prides herself in offering clean rooms at bargain prices. However, the guests are not as impressed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Hilltop Hideaways in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, where cousins in law Lottie and Lil Ellis are on a mission to put the glamorous in glamping.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Runswick Bay, Yorkshire and The Cliffemount Hotel, with general manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty. They hope the views be enough to wow the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Next up is the Quayside Hotel in Boston, Lincolnshire, run by Alistair and partner Lana, where most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels stuck in a neon nightmare.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, run by couple Claire and Adam. Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers, but the other guests are shocked by their surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Swan House in Kelvedon, Essex, where owner Daniele is joined by sister Chantal. On arrival, the traditional d√©cor impresses, but Lana is left with wardrobe woes.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire run by colleagues Genice Hall and Cathy Hudson. There's a battle of the breakfasts, and feedback that cuts deep.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Railway Inn near Hull, run by couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize. The guests find little to complain about, but the pressure is on for Luke's breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Driftwood bed and breakfast in Weymouth, run by Sarah and Pete Healey. On arrival Cathy and Genice find the place completely ship shape and Lygia spies the host's disco balls.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: S01:E09 - TV Dinners

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E10 - Special Occasions

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The episode that has gone down in TV history. Tim Gray was the 21 year-old Head Chef at Bonaparte's in Silsden, West Yorkshire. Claiming to specialise in "fine dining", he had ambitions to be a TV chef and dreamed of opening restaurants in London, Paris and New York. Unfortunately, Tim couldn't even cook an omelette and his trademark scallops made Ramsay throw up. A true kitchen nightmare if ever there was one.
With no customers and a fridge full of fancy ingredients, Bonaparte's was losing money fast. Ramsay soon established that what the people of Silsden really want to eat is Beef and Ale Pie and Treacle Tart. Ramsay soon had the restaurant chocker block but what state is it in now?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Saturday night at The Glass House Restaurant in Ambleside was a disaster. Orders in the kitchen were mixed up, the food wasn't cooked properly and the customers were complaining. Not only was the chef in tears, but the owners were on the brink of bankruptcy.
A few months on, there have been some departures from the Glass House. Who is in charge of the kitchen now? And, more importantly, is Ramsay's Caesar salad still on the menu?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E09 - Episode 9

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E10 - Episode 10

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The Walnut Tree Inn was in big trouble - there was no head chef, the customers had dwindled, and the owner had been forced to sell the family home to keep the business afloat. Set in beautiful Welsh countryside, The Walnut Tree Inn was a successful business for 37 years and became a national institution. But when Francesco bought the place 3 years ago he made the mistake of turning the warm and welcoming country inn into a cold and stark London-style restaurant. And when things went wrong he tried to run the kitchen as well as the front of house. With its Michelin star in jeopardy, Ramsay's first job was to recruit a new head chef so the owner could concentrate on customers. But has Francesco managed to follow Ramsay's advice and stop meddling in the kitchen?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Nick and Richard are self-confessed restaurant virgins. They've both had successful careers in the brewery business so when they bought Moore Place they believed they could make it an instant success. What they hadn't realized was just how difficult it would be to fill the 90-seater oak-paneled restaurant and how hard it would be to find a chef who could cook decent food.
Has Ramsay's fast-track guide to restaurant success helped these brewery whiz-kids transform their failing ex-Berni Inn into a profitable business? And is the building still painted that disgusting shade of purple?

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E09 - TV Dinners

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the South West region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The 2012 competition enters its final week. The winners of the regional heats compete for a chance for their dish to be on the final banquet menu at a prestigious event hosted by Sir Steve Redgrave with a glittering guest list of British Olympians. Here, the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight winners of the regional heats prepare to cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing. Before they get into the kitchen, they must first learn whether they will all be cooking.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. After a hard-fought week, the end of this programme will see the judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this year's `Great British Menu'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This final programme follows the successful chefs in the run-up to the Olympic banquet at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, as they make the painstaking preparations for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook. The four winning chefs prepare an outstanding four-course menu for a truly Olympian guest list.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: rabbit with pea mousse, ham hock with pea puree and heather smoked macon with pickled beetroot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the South West - Henry Herbert, John Hooker and Nathan Outlaw - are all out to impress with their fish dishes: cider-cured sea trout, poached lobster with courgette flowers and trout, crayfish and pike mousse.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of London and the South East's finest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Mark Froydenlund. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the London and South East chefs are striving to secure one of the two spots in tomorrow's Regional Final. The scores are close, so it's all to play for, as today marks the end of the competition for one man.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the halfway point in finals week and those chefs who have yet to get a dish onto the shortlist are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by Baroness Trumpington who worked as a cypher clerk at Bletchley Park from 1941 to 1946.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs to get their dish in contention for the final banquet and those who've failed to finish in the top three so far are going all out. Joining the judges is Celia Sandys, Winston Churchill's granddaughter.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring advice on how to plant spring flowering perennials for instant impact and recommendations for planting bare root roses full of fragrance in borders and pots. Monty will also begin planning the vegetable garden for the year ahead.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring approaches, it's time to get going with sowing seeds and Monty recommends varieties to sow now for months of summer colour. With conifers enjoying a revival, he also plants up a pot to give interest all year round.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Black Cloud

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‚Ä™@ben_moon‚Ä¨ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we‚Äôll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they‚Äôve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Gear Lab
